Name: Dominique Wilkins
Note: Currently team vice president and television color analyst.

Name: Ted Turner
Note: As team owner. While the team presented Turner a framed Hawks jersey with No. 17, the banner raised to the rafters carried an old Hawks logo with Turner's name instead of a number.

Name: Satch Sanders
Note: Also served as head coach (1978).

Name: Reggie Lewis
Note: Died of a heart attack while still playing for the team; number retired posthumously.

Name: Jim Loscutoff
Note: Wore No. 18 but decided to keep it active; number ultimately retired for Dave Cowens.

Name: Johnny Most
Note: As broadcaster.

Name: Dražen Petrović
Note: Died in a car crash while playing for the team; with the team when it was known as the New Jersey Nets. His jersey was retired posthumously.

Name: Wendell Ladner
Note: Died in a plane crash; with the team when it was on Long Island as the New York Nets. His jersey was retired posthumously; however no banner is currently raised at the Barclays Center.

Name: Bill Melchionni
Note: The team was then on Long Island as the New York Nets.

Name: Julius Erving
Note: The team was then on Long Island as the New York Nets.

Name: Buck Williams
Note: The team was then the New Jersey Nets.

Name: Michael Jordan
Note: Briefly wore No. 45 in 1995 & 12 for one game in 1991 (due to his jersey stolen).

Name: Jerry Krause
Note: As general manager.

Name: Larry Nance
Note: Briefly wore No. 6 in 1988.

Name: Joe Tait
Note: As broadcaster.

Name: Doug Moe
Note: As head coach; the number represents his 432 victories coaching the Nuggets.

Name: Chuck Daly
Note: As head coach; the number represents the two NBA championship teams he coached.

Name: Dennis Rodman
Note: Number currently issued to Greg Monroe at the time of the announcement, and he is allowed to continue wearing the number.

Name: Isiah Thomas
Note: Wore No. 42 for one playoff game in 1985 (due to his jersey stolen).

Note: As team owner.

Name: Jack McCloskey

Name: Chris Mullin
Note: Also served as Executive Vice President of Basketball Operations (2004-2009).

Name: Bobby Leonard
Note: As head coach; the number represents his 529 victories coaching the Pacers.

Name: Earvin \Magic\" Johnson"
Note: Also served as head coach in 1994.

Name: Chick Hearn
Note: As broadcaster.

Name: Michael Jordan
Note: Never played for the franchise; number retired for \contributions to basketball\"."

Name: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
Note: Served under the name of Lew Alcindor for two seasons before becoming Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

Name: Malik Sealy
Note: Died in a car crash while playing for the team. His jersey was retired posthumously.

Name: Bobby Phills
Note: Died in a car crash while playing for the team; with the team when it was in Charlotte. His jersey was retired posthumously.

Name: Walt Frazier
Note: Also served as a broadcaster.

Name: Red Holzman
Note: As head coach; the number represents his 613 victories coaching the Knicks.

Name: Moses Malone

Note: Also served as head coach (1987).

Name: Cotton Fitzsimmons
Note: As head coach; inducted in the Suns' Ring of Honor posthumously.

Name: Joe Proski
Note: As athletic trainer.

Note: As team founder and owner; number still available.

Note: As head coach; the number represents the 1977 NBA Championship he won while coaching the Blazers.

Name: Bob Davies
